definition:
A sneeze (also known as
sternutation) is a semi-autonomous, convulsive expulsion of air from
the lungs through the nose and mouth, usually caused by foreign
particles irritating the nasal mucosa. A sneeze expels air forcibly
from the mouth and nose in an explosive, spasmodic involuntary action.
This action allows for mucus to escape through the nasal cavity.[from
Wikipedia]
